revised_title: David Gwynne Evans: A Pioneering Figure in Bacteriology and Immunology
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Bacteriology and Immunology
tldr: This biographical memoir highlights the life and work of David Gwynne Evans, a prominent figure in bacteriology and immunology. Evans made significant contributions to the development of vaccines against various diseases, including whooping cough and poliomyelitis. He also played a crucial role in establishing the British standard pertussis vaccine and the National Institute for Biological Standards and Control. Throughout his career, Evans was involved in numerous committees responsible for the supervision and planning of vaccine research and development.
